mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Is "shocked" by what Gardiner has told him about Beeman; claims that it only proves that VanNess is "treacherous"; believes that VanNess is responsible for a letter in the N.Y. Herald that was "abusive" to the President; feels that in the Aurora matter Gardiner's uncle should be appointed, but if it can't be him, recommends Mr. Cooper. Autograph Letter Signed.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, no year December 31, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Alexander Gardiner, New York, N.Y.
